Dennis N. Stetsenko Sun, 24 Aug 2003 01:12:06 -0400
>> I'm trying to figure out the best way to extend/modify JUnit
>> framework + Ant Task to fit my specific needs, like:

>> 1) I'm capturing screenshot and making snapshot of the application
>> log file on each failure/error.

>> 2) I've extended TestCase class (ETestCase) to add extra
>> information per each executed test case (unique requirement id
>> string -> ETestCase.req_id)

>> 3) In case of failure/error I add unique string id of a screenshot
>> to the ETestCase (ETestCase.picture_id)

>> So, I want to automate execution of tests such way that I would
>> receive XML file at the end with all custom fields from ETestCase
>> (in order to make html afterwards with links to screenshots/log
>> files for every failed test case).

J. B. Rainsberger Sun, 24 Aug 2003 18:03:45 -0400
> Try using the JUnit-addons Test Runner.

http://sourceforge.net/projects/junit-addons

> It allows you to register a test listener that will help you know
> when to take a snapshot of the application log file.

> For producing the XML file, register another listener that builds in
> memory the object model you want to dump to XML, then use something
> like the Jakarta Commons Digester to turn that object model into an
> XML document.

This sounds like it could be a very useful general extension, esp for
GUI testing. (The logfile-linking capability would be more generally
useful, but perhaps of lesser value for the general user than the
screenshot-linking capability would be for the GUI-test user.)

TIA, Tom Roche, WebSphere Studio Model2 Tooling
